Award.AwardTitle: REU Site: Optics and photonics: Technologies, Systems, and Devices

Division.LongName: Div Of Engineering Education and Centers

Award.AbstractNarration:
This Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site hosted by New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) focuses on engaging undergraduate students from underrepresented populations and from institutions with limited research opportunities, such as community colleges, in research in the key emerging topics of optics and photonics technologies, systems and devices and inspiring them to consider continuing graduate education in electrical and computer engineering and related areas. Optical and photonic technologies, devices and systems are enablers for modern communication systems, sensors and computing. By focusing on next generation optical and photonics technologies and systems, this program seeks to increase the number of students entering the workforce with skills in this area.

This REU Site offers opportunities for undergraduate students to engage in optics and photonics research, with faculty mentors and their research teams, during an intensive and unique 10-week summer program in three focus areas: 1) optical communication and networking; 2) optical and photonic devices; and 3) optical systems. The REU students' laboratory experience will be enhanced by technical seminars and workshops on non-technical topics, such as presentation skills and ethics. Each student will prepare a final report and give a presentation on his or her project at the end of the program at NJIT's International Undergraduate Summer Research Symposium.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Optical and photonic technologies, devices and systems are enablers for modern communication systems, sensors and computing. This Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site hosted by New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) offered opportunities for undergraduate students to engage in optics and photonics research, with faculty mentors and their research teams, during an intensive and unique 10-week summer program in each year between 2016 and 2018 in three focus areas: 1) optical communication and networking; 2) optical and photonic devices; and 3) optical systems. The REU students' laboratory experience was enhanced by technical seminars and workshops on non-technical topics, such as presentation skills, ethics, preparation for graduate school and other professional development activities. Each student prepared a final report and gave a presentation on his or her project at the end of the program at NJIT's International Undergraduate Summer Research Symposium. A competition was held each summer at the end of the program with the judges being independent reviewers from outside the program. The competition encouraged the participants to produce competitive publications in several journal and conferences.

The objectives of the program were to engage undergraduate students from underrepresented populations and from institutions with limited research opportunities, such as community colleges, in research in the key emerging topics of optics and photonics technologies, systems and devices and inspiring them to consider continuing graduate education in electrical and computer engineering and related areas. Another objective of the program was to increase the number of students entering the workforce with skills in the broad area of optics and photonics.

Exit surveys conducted by independent evaluators showed that the above objectives have been met. Also, the research skills gained by the participants enabled many of them to be admitted to top US graduate and medical schools. Many other participants have pursued career in several STEM fields related to optics and photonics. Many of the participants were selected from underrepresented groups.
